title: TEALE-Based Instructional Design Course for TPACK and Technology Belief Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Foundational Educational Theories and Social Studies Content
context.additional_context: PBL-based course for pre-service teachers (current practitioners) in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Emphasizes technology-integrated instructional design competencies in social studies education

learning_goals: Achieve mastery of over 80% in each TPACK component (content knowledge, pedagogical knowledge, technological knowledge)
Develop the ability to create educational technology tool utilization plans based on the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM)
Develop two or more learner-customized technology-integrated lesson plans through PBL projects
Confirm a 15% or greater positive shift in technology beliefs based on the Technology Beliefs Survey
Conduct peer feedback five or more times using smartphone-based assessment tools

resources: Digital resource library for social studies curriculum
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
